thread.title: Man Utd's Zlatan Ibrahimovic posts snap with Fabio Capello | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Man Utd's Zlatan Ibrahimovic posts snap with Fabio Capello | Daily Mail Online

author: Amitai Winehouse For Mailonline
title: Man Utd's Zlatan Ibrahimovic posts snap with Fabio Capello | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share In a caption on the post, Ibrahimovic wrote: 'The person who changed my game Fabio Capello'. Capello had a significant influence on the 35-year-old's style of play when he played under him for two seasons at Juventus. He joined the club in 2004 and had a blistering debut season, scoring 16 goals in all competitions. The manager then changed his role in the side, playing him as more of a target man with a greater remit to involve himself in link-up play. Ibrahimovic bagged the winning goal for United against Blackburn in the FA Cup fifth round It took him a season to adapt - with a cost in terms of goals - but when Ibrahimovic moved on to join Inter Milan, it had made him a better player. He left having twice won the Italian title, although they were later withdrawn in the Calciopoli scandal. He certainly showed his talent on Sunday evening, coming off the bench against Blackburn Rovers to score in the 75th minute to send United through to the quarter-finals. Ibrahimovic and the Old Trafford club take on St Etienne in the Europa League on Wednesday night. RELATED ARTICLES
